content: <ce:para id="p0030" view="all">The heterometallic copper(II)-sodium 1D coordination polymer <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, {[Cu(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)Na(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)(η<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>-L)]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (), was obtained with 48% yield by mixing (stirring for 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min) of a water solution of H<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>L, NaOH and copper(II) nitrate hydrate at room temperature. Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis were obtained after 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>d. The IR spectrum of this complex displays <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(C<ce:glyph name="dbnd"></ce:glyph>O) at 1699 and 1647<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>, values significantly shifted in relation to those of the free ligand. Moreover, a hypsochromic shift in the UV–vis spectra of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> is observed in comparison to the UV–vis spectra of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (478 and 457<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>nm, for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, respectively, see Fig. S1), confirming the n<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>→<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>π* or ligand-to-metal electron transitions.</ce:para>
clean_text: The heterometallic copper(II)-sodium 1D coordination polymer 2, {[Cu(H2O)Na(H2O)(η9-L)]⋅2H2O}n (), was obtained with 48% yield by mixing (stirring for 5min) of a water solution of H3L, NaOH and copper(II) nitrate hydrate at room temperature. Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis were obtained after 2d. The IR spectrum of this complex displays ν(CO) at 1699 and 1647cm-1, values significantly shifted in relation to those of the free ligand. Moreover, a hypsochromic shift in the UV-vis spectra of 2 is observed in comparison to the UV-vis spectra of 1 (478 and 457nm, for 1 and 2, respectively, see Fig. S1), confirming the n→π* or ligand-to-metal electron transitions.
